datafield.subfield: The Janus Press Archive contains material relating to the production of books, posters and broadsides, and printed ephemera bearing the Janus Press imprint, as well as other projects carried out with the assistance of its founder Claire Van Vliet, covering the period from 1955 to the present.
Rare Book and Special Collections Division

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Special Materials Cataloging Division, Library of Congress 1998

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Rare Book and Special Collections Division Library of Congress

did.abstract: The Janus Press Archive contains material relating to the production of books, posters and broadsides, and printed ephemera bearing the Janus Press imprint, as well as other projects carried out with the assistance of its founder Claire Van Vliet, covering the period from 1955 to the present.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: Janus Press Archive (Library of Congress) DLC

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p:
The Janus Press Archive was purchased from Claire Van Vliet, proprietor of Janus Press,
in September, 1991. As an open collection, additional materials are added as they are
received.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p:
As far as possible, the material retains the arrangement provided by Claire Van Vliet,
who has supplied distinctive boxes for housing. Often Van Vliet has arranged and labelled
folders (these have been retained); when she has not, folders have been added for
organizational and listing purposes, and materials grouped according to type, for
example, correspondence followed by typescripts and paste-ups, production materials, etc.
In order to connect the material in the Janus Press Archive to the resulting publication
housed in the Janus Press Collection, also housed in the Rare Book and Special
Collections Division, the LCCN for each work is noted in parentheses in this finding aid.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The records of the Janus Press Archive are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Rare Book and Special Collections Division reading room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The Janus Press Archive contains material relating to the production of books, posters
and broadsides, and printed ephemera bearing the Janus Press imprint, as well as other
projects carried out with the assistance of its founder Claire Van Vliet, covering the
period from 1955 to the present.

Includes correspondence, annotated typescripts, proofs, paste-ups and layouts, book
designers' mockups, woodblocks, linocut blocks, etched and engraved plates, binding
structures, paper and fabric samples, a record and compact disc, notes, drawings, and
receipts.

Correspondents include Clifford Burke, Bob Ewert, Ruth Fine, W.R. Johnson, Margaret
Kaufman, Charles Seluzicki, Helen Siegl, the Limited Editions Club, Stinehour Press, and
W.Thomas Taylor.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Papers
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Books. II. Posters and Broadsides. Arranged chronologically by publication date of work to which materials relate.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
A related collection in the Rare Book and Special Collections Division of the Library of
Congress is the King Lear Archive, which contains preparatory
materials for an edition of Shakespeare's play published by Theodore Press in 1986, with
illustrations printed at the Janus Press.
